intro: Malachra capitata var. mollis, commonly known as the silky malachra, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms. The species is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
